titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-521, by Mr. Sessions.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 121.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 708.

POINT OF ORDER - During the course of debate on H.Res. 708, exception was taken to certain words used and a demand was made to have words taken down. Subsequently, unanimous consent was granted to withdraw the words in question and debate continued under regular order.
POINT OF ORDER - During the course of debate, exception was taken to the use of an exhibit used. The Chair viewed the exhibit and found that the exhibit did not constitute a breach of decorum.
Mr. Perlmutter appealed the ruling of the chair. The question was then put on sustaining the ruling of the chair.
Mr. Cole moved to table the motion to appeal the ruling of the chair
On motion to table the motion to appeal the ruling of the chair Agreed to by recorded vote: 224 - 173, 2 Present (Roll no. 40).
DEBATE - The House resumed with debate on H. Res. 708.

WORDS TAKEN DOWN - During the course of debate on H.Res. 708, exception was taken to certain words used and a demand was made to have words taken down. Subsequently, unanimous consent was granted to withdraw the words in question and debate continued under regular order.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 180 (Roll no. 41).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 170 (Roll no. 42).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
Waives a specified requirement of Rule XIII (Calendar and Committee Reports) to allow consideration of any resolution reported from the Committee on Rules through the legislative day of January 29, 2018, on the same day it is presented to the House.
Makes it in order at any time through the legislative day of January 28, 2018, for the Speaker of the House to suspend the rules.
